qas.question: Who was most influential in Islamic philosophy?
What method did Ibn Sina introduce?
The Kitab al-shifa and The Canon of Medicine are considered what?
What characteristic did Ibn Sina find out about infectious diseases?

context: <a0_0>Ibn Sina<a0_0/> (Avicenna) is regarded as the most influential philosopher of Islam. He pioneered the science of experimental medicine and was the first physician to conduct <a1_0>clinical trials<a1_0/>. His two most notable works in medicine are the Kitāb al-shifāʾ ("<a2_0>Book of Healing<a2_0/>") and The Canon of Medicine, both of which were used as <a3_0>standard medicinal texts<a3_0/> in both the Muslim world and in Europe well into the 17th century. Amongst his many contributions are the discovery of the <a4_0>contagious<a4_0/> nature of infectious diseases, and the introduction of clinical pharmacology.
